rooms.name: ap
rooms.longDescription: A very unique room containing other-worldly objects. The room glows from the light of a wall of flames that burns without consuming the room. On the other side of the room floats a lidless eye that is ever watchful of those that enter the room.

rooms.name: ar
rooms.longDescription: A naturally lit room for storing items of wars fought centuries ago. The room has many have chips on the walls.  Did knights of old do sword fighting in this room?

rooms.name: bd
rooms.longDescription: A room used exclusively by the dungeon's master torturer. Without a lantern, it is difficult to identify the shadowy outlines of objects that appear to be in the room.

rooms.name: bh
rooms.longDescription: A large lit room containing a massive chandelier that hangs over a large dining table centered in the middle of the room.  There is a set of earthenware made from clay that adrons the corners of the room

rooms.name: ca
rooms.longDescription: A room with a high ceiling that is lit from torches placed high on all four walls. There is a large portrait of a hideous looking old man on the western wall and a large gateleg table in the center of the room. Next to the table is a bar stool.

rooms.name: ce
rooms.longDescription: A room that is lit from the beams of sunshine piercing through the slats of a corrugated steel door. The walls and ceiling are composed of coarse granite stone while the floor is mostly dirt covered with crawling insects and scattered shale rocks.

rooms.name: cl
rooms.longDescription: A dark musty room that still reeks from the smell of rotting flesh. The room was used to confine subjects used in the Wizard's experiments.

rooms.name: ct
rooms.longDescription: A dark room that does not appear to have any exits. If one can illuminate the room with artificial light, maybe one can find a secret panel or lever to use

rooms.name: hw
rooms.longDescription: A lighted long room with exits on three of it's walls. A wool rug lays in middle of the room and a painting is hanging on it's northern wall

rooms.name: jl
rooms.longDescription: The room was used by the Wizard's personal jailors. Although the room has no natural lighting, the outline of several objects can be seen as well as a small glittering of light reflecting off cell bars at the western end of the room

rooms.name: kt
rooms.longDescription: A room used to perpare meals for the dungeon's inhabitants.  It has skylighting in the ceiling which highlights the filthy conditions of the room.

rooms.name: ot
rooms.longDescription: CONGRATULATIONS!!! ... you have escaped the Haunted Dungeon

rooms.name: pw
rooms.longDescription: A long dark narrow corridor that leads deeper into the dungeon's depths. It's one big labyrinth of twists and turns connecting the evils inside with the outside world.

rooms.name: sq
rooms.longDescription: A large lighted room that was used by the wizard's staff. The room has a bunk bed in the south west corner of the room and a round table in the northeast corner.  There is a large bearshin in the center of the floor and a rocking chair next to the table.

rooms.name: sr
rooms.longDescription: A room used to store food and other household items.  It's covered in cobwebs, crawling insects and dead insects.

rooms.name: tr
rooms.longDescription: A secret room filled with treasures hidden in the darkness.  The smell of dust and mold is overpowering.  Does this room really contain priceless items or was it used to perform hideous acts of evil?

rooms.name: wl
rooms.longDescription: A laboratory containing various items used by the Wizard.  It does not have any natural lighting, therefore a working lantern is required to see the contents of the room

exits.name: ap1
exits.longDescription: An strange portal that looks like an 'oblivion gate' on the western wall surrounded by intricate carvings of gargoyle like creatures
exits.shortDescription: An 'oblivion gate' on the west wall

exits.name: ar1
exits.longDescription: A set of 'winder stairs' consisting of circular steps leading north towards to the Hallway.  More than half of the handrails have been broken, suggesting that a potentially violent event may have occurred here
exits.shortDescription: 'Winder stairs' going north

exits.name: ar2
exits.longDescription: A old 'rusting iron door' with many battlescars on the east wall that leads to the Jail.  Many of the dents and scratches in the door appear to be caused by a sharp object. Dark red stains appear at several locations on the door.
exits.shortDescription: 'Rusting iron door' on the east wall

exits.name: ar3
exits.longDescription: A very heavy grey 'solid metal door' mounted insided a welded frame on the south wall.  The door leads to the Sleeping Quarters and has a deadbolt assembly mounted on it although it appears the lock's cylinder bolt is missing
exits.shortDescription: 'Solid metal door' on the south wall

exits.name: bd1
exits.longDescription: An 'old wooden door' on the eastern wall with many boot marks on it that leads to the Sleeping Quarters. The excessing kicking has produced significant cracking of the wood
exits.shortDescription: 'Old wooden door' on the east wall

exits.name: bh1
exits.longDescription: A set of 'splintered double doors' on the north wall leading to the Kitchen. Food strains and other dark stains are spattered across the doors
exits.shortDescription: 'Splintered double doors' on the north wall

exits.name: bh2
exits.longDescription: A 'monstrous archway' on the east wall over 16 feet high going into the Hallway.  Mystical creatures of various kinds are carved into the archway.
exits.shortDescription: 'Monstrous archway' on the east wall

exits.name: ca1
exits.longDescription: A large heavy 'rolling shutter door' on the south wall that goes to the Passage Way.
exits.shortDescription: 'Rolling shutter door' on the south wall

exits.name: ca2
exits.longDescription: A pair of 'smoky glazed doors' on the east wall that leads into the Kitchen
exits.shortDescription: 'Smoky glazed doors' on the east wall

exits.name: ce1
exits.longDescription: A 'corrugated steel door' on the south wall leading to the outside world.
exits.shortDescription: 'Corrugated steel door' on the south wall

exits.name: ce2
exits.longDescription: A 'long dark tunnel' heading north that is filled with crawling insects and other creatures.  The tunnel is used to enter the Passage Way room
exits.shortDescription: 'Long dark tunnel' at the north end of the cave

exits.name: cl1
exits.longDescription: A 'creaking cell door' on the west side of the room that leads to the Jail. The door has multiple handcuffs clamped to its bars
exits.shortDescription: 'Creaking cell door' on the west side

exits.name: hw1
exits.longDescription: A 'monstrous archway' on the west wall over 16 feet high going into the Banquet Hall.  Mystical creatures of various kinds are carved into the archway.
exits.shortDescription: 'Monstrous archway' on the west wall

exits.name: hw2
exits.longDescription: A large 'bell archway' on the east wall connecting the Hallway to the Wizard's Laboratory
exits.shortDescription: 'Bell archway' on the east wall

exits.name: hw3
exits.longDescription: A set of 'winder stairs' on the south end of the room consisting of circular steps leading to the Armory.  More than half of the handrails have been broken, suggesting that a potentially violent event may have occurred on them
exits.shortDescription: 'Winder stairs' on the south end of the room

exits.name: jl1
exits.longDescription: An old 'rusting iron door' on the west wall with many battlescars leading to the Armory.  Many of the dents and scratches in the door appear to be caused by a sharp object. Deep red stains appear at several locations on the door.
exits.shortDescription: 'Rusting iron door' on the west wall

exits.name: jl2
exits.longDescription: A 'creaking cell door' on the east end of the room that leads to a cell. The door has multiple handcuffs clamped to its bars
exits.shortDescription: 'Creaking cell door' on the east end of the room

exits.name: kt1
exits.longDescription: A pair of 'smoky glazed doors' on the west wall that leads to the Common Area
exits.shortDescription: 'Smoky glazed doors' on the west wall

exits.name: kt2
exits.longDescription: A 'swinging door' on the east wall that creaks a high pitched sound when going to the Storeroom
exits.shortDescription: 'Swinging door' on the east wall

exits.name: kt3
exits.longDescription: A set of 'splintered double doors' on the south wall leading to the Banquet Hall. Food strains and other dark stains are spattered across the doors
exits.shortDescription: 'Splintered double doors' on the south wall

exits.name: out
exits.longDescription: A 'corrugated steel door' on the north wall used to access the cave entrance.
exits.shortDescription: 'Corrugated steel door' on the north wall

exits.name: pw1
exits.longDescription: A 'long dark tunnel' going south filled with crawling insects and other creatures that connects to the Cave Entrance
exits.shortDescription: 'Long dark tunnel' going south

exits.name: pw2
exits.longDescription: A large heavy 'rolling shutter door' on the north wall that leads into the Common Area.
exits.shortDescription: 'Rolling shutter door' on the north wall

exits.name: sq1
exits.longDescription: A heavy grey 'solid metal door' mounted insided a welded frame on the north wall.  The door leads to the Armory and has a deadbolt assembly mounted on it, although it appears the lock's cylinder bolt is missing
exits.shortDescription: 'Solid metal door' on the north wall

exits.name: sq2
exits.longDescription: An 'old wooden door' on the west wall with many boot marks on it leading to the Bedroom. The excessing kicking has produced significant cracking of the wood
exits.shortDescription: 'Old wooden door' on the west wall

exits.name: sr1
exits.longDescription: A 'swinging door' on the west wall that creaks a high pitched sound when going to the Kitchen
exits.shortDescription: 'Swinging door' on the west wall

exits.name: tr1
exits.longDescription: A 'rusted spiral staircase' on the west wall that makes several loops while ascending to the Storeroom
exits.shortDescription: 'Rusted spiral staircase' on the west wall

exits.name: wl1
exits.longDescription: A large 'bell archway' on the west wall connecting the Wizard's Laboratory to the Hallway
exits.shortDescription: 'Bell archway' on the west wall

exits.name: wl2
exits.longDescription: A strange portal on the east wall that looks like an 'oblivion gate' surrounded by intricate carvings of gargoyle like creatures
exits.shortDescription: 'Oblivion gate' on the east wall

objects.name: altar
objects.longDescription: An elevated structure that was used in dark ceremonies performed by the Wizard. Blood stains still cover the top surface and flows down all sides in a pattern suggesting that someone had laid on the altar. What is that on the altar and also above it?.

objects.name: green apple
objects.longDescription: A crisp and juicy fleshy fruit that can improve your health when eaten

objects.name: red apple
objects.longDescription: A crisp and juicy fleshy fruit that can improve your health when eaten

objects.name: armoire
objects.longDescription: A tall cabinet used for storing clothes and occasionally weapons.  The armoire is made of dark antiquie walnut wood and has a single door that is opened on the front.

objects.name: armor
objects.longDescription: The upper arms are protected by fully covering rounded rerebraces while the lower arms are covered by vambraces.  The breastplate is made from many layers of pointed metal sheets and the legs are protected by greaves which have a curved pointed edge at the knee joint.  Provides some protection to the player when equipped

objects.name: axe
objects.longDescription: Made from wrought iron with a carbon steel edge on a crescent-shaped head.  It is moderately heavy and can inflict significant damage to opponents when used.

objects.name: bearskin
objects.longDescription: A dark brown bear rug that has very soft and long hair with a silver tip color. The rug looks comfortable enough to lay on

objects.name: bunk bed
objects.longDescription: A double framed bed with one bed supported above another by four large pillars. The bed looks comfortable enough to lay on.  There appears to be an object under the bed

objects.name: twin bed
objects.longDescription: A bed that has been used extensively. The middle of the bed sags downward, hinting of a large person that once slept there

objects.name: bat skeleton
objects.longDescription: The remains of a bat that died years ago. The greatly elongated bones of the fore limbs hint that the wing span of the bat exceeded 15 inches.

objects.name: cat skeleton
objects.longDescription: The remains of a cat that died in the passageway. The unsually large eye sockets and powerful jaws suggest that the cat was an efficient predator within the haunted dungeon.

objects.name: human skeleton
objects.longDescription: The remains of one of the unfortunate subjects used in the Wizard's experiments. The skeleton still has some flesh attached to it that is giving off a horrendous decaying odor

objects.name: book of spells
objects.longDescription: A book containing various spells used by the Wizard. One spell is used to create a demonic portal to a different dimension

objects.name: book of locks
objects.longDescription: A catch-all book about locksmithing.  Probably a best seller for those locked in a Haunted Dungeon cell.

objects.name: bottle of water
objects.longDescription: Contains water that can replinish the health of a player when drank

objects.name: bottle of gatorade
objects.longDescription: Contains a beverage that can replinish the health of a player when drank

objects.name: bottleopener
objects.longDescription: A device that is used to open bottles.  When in the player's inventory, any bottle that is also in the inventory can be drank.

objects.name: carver chair
objects.longDescription: A spool chair having three vertical and three horizontal spindles in the back. The chair looks comfortable enough that sitting on it might refresh the player

objects.name: rocking chair
objects.longDescription: A chair frame mounted on rockers that allows the chair to gently rock back and forth. Looks good enough to sit on

objects.name: chandelier
objects.longDescription: A large decorative hangling light with eight branches for holding candles. All the candles are missing and the cobwebs are so thick bewteen the branches that it almost appears as one solid structure

objects.name: cloak
objects.longDescription: A sleeveless overgarment that hangs loosely from the shoulders. The garment gives hints of magical powers when equipped. Could this be an invisibility cloak?

objects.name: desk
objects.longDescription: An old steel office desk that looks very heavy. It appears that there maybe something on the desk as well as inside it

objects.name: stoneware
objects.longDescription: Hard nontranslucent set of pottery dishes. The heavy dishes were probably used by the staff serving the Wizard.

objects.name: fine china
objects.longDescription: A set of soft-paste porcelain dishes that were probably exclusively used by the Wizard

objects.name: earthenware
objects.longDescription: A set of low quality clay pottery dishes used by the prisoners in the Haunted Dungeon

objects.name: lidless eye
objects.longDescription: A large floating lidless eye that follows and closely watches any visitor to the Alternate Plane

objects.name: wall of flames
objects.longDescription: A 10ft high wall of flames that generates soaring temperatures and hellish conditions to those around it

objects.name: gem
objects.longDescription: A mineral crystal that almost glows green with its own internal light. Must be very valueable

objects.name: cooking hearth
objects.longDescription: A stone lined fireplace with a heavy iron pot that is used to heat meals.  There does not appear to be any fire wood for lighting the hearth

objects.name: helmet
objects.longDescription: A sugar loaf visored helmet that was popular in the 14th century. Provides some protection to the player when equipped.

objects.name: golden key
objects.longDescription: A key with intricate markings on it. Seems to be an important object due to the high craftsmanship required to make the key. Could this key be ticket out of the Haunted Dungeon?

objects.name: key rung
objects.longDescription: A wall fixture for hanging keys. The fixture is empty

objects.name: kitchen knife
objects.longDescription: A large chef knife used for carving turkeys. Its big enough to use as a weapon when equipped

objects.name: broken lantern
objects.longDescription: A lantern that has had its gas burner removed. No way to light this lantern

objects.name: brass lantern
objects.longDescription: A working 24 inch polished brass clipper ship lantern.  All that's needed to light the lantern is some matches.

objects.name: wooden lever
objects.longDescription: A wooden handle that has been worn down by being pulled often.

objects.name: iron lever
objects.longDescription: An iron bar that looks to have been pushed many times

objects.name: lockpick
objects.longDescription: A large hook pick used to open tumbler locks found on common iron trunks

objects.name: matches
objects.longDescription: A large box of stick matches that are coated on one end with a compound that ignites when scratched

objects.name: mattress
objects.longDescription: A small dirty mattress that offers very little padding. Doesn't look comfortable enough to lay on.  There appears to be something on the mattress and under the mattress

objects.name: mushrooms
objects.longDescription: An assortment of edible mushrooms that offers healing powers when eaten

objects.name: note
objects.longDescription: A folded note that has top secret scribbled on the outside. Maybe it's secret would be revealed if it was read

objects.name: portrait
objects.longDescription: A portrait of an old geezer that resembles the Scrooge. Seems the geezer is hiding something ... what's that behind the portrait?

objects.name: painting
objects.longDescription: A painting of the Haunted Dungeon as seen from the cliffs below

objects.name: magical ring
objects.longDescription: A ring that has strange writings on it that glow in the dark. Could it have magical powers when equipped?

objects.name: shale rocks
objects.longDescription: A fined-grained clastic sedimentary rock that is composed of mud that is a mix of flakes of clay minerals and tiny fragments of other minerals

objects.name: slate rocks
objects.longDescription: A fine-grained homogenous metamorphic rock derived from a sedimentary rock composed of clay or volcanic ash

objects.name: turkish rug
objects.longDescription: A rug made from a combination of wool and silk and displays a motif of colors and patterns. Could this rug be safe to lay on?  Looking closer it appears that something may be under the rug

objects.name: wool rug
objects.longDescription: An ordinary grey colored wool rug. Could laying on this rug help restore health?

objects.name: slate of runes
objects.longDescription: A large slate tablet filled with various odd symbols all over it, somehow untouched by time and the elements

objects.name: safe
objects.longDescription: A small combination safe used to store valuables. One must first know the combination before they can look inside to see what it contains

objects.name: scroll
objects.longDescription: A small scroll that is sealed with a skull and cross bones seal.  Wonder what secrets can be learned by reading it

objects.name: metal shelves
objects.longDescription: Heavy metal shelving units used to store items on. Could there be any items on the shelves now?

objects.name: corner shelves
objects.longDescription: A 4-Tier corner shelf used to store items on. Could there be items on the shelf now?

objects.name: wooden shelves
objects.longDescription: A set of wooden shelves mounted to the wall that are used to store items on. Could there be items on the shelves now?   What's that behind the shelves?

objects.name: sign
objects.longDescription: A sign posted outside the cave entrance with large letters printed on it.

objects.name: bar stool
objects.longDescription: A tall chair with a rigid seat and a foot rest to support the feet. Looks like a good place to sit on when tired

objects.name: milking stool
objects.longDescription: A short stool with three legs and no backrest. It doesn't look that comfortable, however how bad could it be when sitting on it.

objects.name: machete
objects.longDescription: A large heavy knife used for clearing underbrush that can also be used as a weapon when equipped

objects.name: sabre
objects.longDescription: A curved single-edge blade optimized for delivering a cut or slash. When equipped the sabre can be used as an effective weapon

objects.name: gateleg table
objects.longDescription: An oak table with drop leaves supported by movable paired legs.  Could there be any items on the table?

objects.name: kitchen table
objects.longDescription: A long barrack style wooden table with benches on each side.  Could there be any items on the table?

objects.name: dining table
objects.longDescription: A plank surface antique table of exceptional quality that comfortably seats twelve. Could there be any items on the table?

objects.name: high table
objects.longDescription: A table with its surface a full four feet above the floor.  Could there be any items on the table?

objects.name: round table
objects.longDescription: A large circular table with heavy legs for holding heavy objects. Could there be any items on the table?

objects.name: trestle table
objects.longDescription: A long bench table consisting of three trestle supports linked by a longitudinal cross-member. Could there be any items on the table?

objects.name: tapestries
objects.longDescription: A thick textile fabric with intricate design patterns hanging on the wall

objects.name: tools
objects.longDescription: A heavy set of tools used when shoeing horses

objects.name: trapdoor
objects.longDescription: A small square hinged door that is flush with the surface of the floor. There is a handle in the center of the door.  Wonder what happens then the trapdoor is pulled

objects.name: treasure
objects.longDescription: A valuable collection of gold coins and trinkets

objects.name: tree
objects.longDescription: A large oak tree with branches spaning above the entrace to the cave

objects.name: iron trunk
objects.longDescription: A trunk made of iron that uses a tumbler lock to secure the valuable items inside.  A look inside the trunk requires a lockpick in the players inventory

objects.name: cedar trunk
objects.longDescription: An Amish trunk that is normally used to store blankets and bedding accessories. Wonder what is stored inside this trunk

objects.name: warhammer
objects.longDescription: A heavy medieval weapon of war intended for close combat action. The warhammer is a lethal weapon when equipped.

ghosts.name: blinky
ghosts.longDescription: Considered the leader of the ghost gang, Blinky is the toughest and most lethal ghost in the game. He randomly traverses all the rooms in the game and switches between visibile and non-visible modes depending upon his mood. He does not actively pursue the player, however when visible and in the same room as the player he is a force to be reckoned with.

ghosts.name: clyde
ghosts.longDescription: Although not as lethal as Blinky, Clyde is still a major threat to the player. He is both tough to kill and deadly in his attacks against the player. Clyde restricts himself to a subset of the rooms in the game and has a higher potential of being visible than Blinky. Since ghosts can only attack when uncloaked, the player has a higher probability of engaging with Clyde than with Blinky.

ghosts.name: inky
ghosts.longDescription: Inky is the most fickle of all the ghost. Sometimes she feels aggressive and other times not so much. She tends to restrict herself to a subset of the rooms and will either try to flee from the player or fight, depending upon her mood. She is more powerful than Pinky, however not as tough or lethal as either Clyde or Blinky.

ghosts.name: pinky
ghosts.longDescription: Pinky is the most aggressive ghost in the game. Fortunately for the player she is also the weakest and least deadly. She often positions herself in either the room the player is in or an adjoining room hoping to ambush the player when he comes in. She can be found in any of the rooms.

verbs.description: attack <ghost>: Used to attack a ghost
drink <object>: Used to certain objects to restore health
drop <object>: Used to remove objects from inventory
eat <object>: Used on certain objects to restore heatlh
equip <object>: Used to activate wearable and wieldable objects
go <direction|exit description>: Used to move a player to another room
help: Used to list status of all ghosts
help: Used to list supported verbs
inventory: Used to list all objects in the player's inventory
lay <on> <object>: Used on certain objects to modify health
light <object>: Used to light certain objects
loadgame: Loads a saved game
look <at|under|on|behind|inside|above> <object>: Used to look on an object
pull <object>: Used to pull on an object
push <object>: Used to push on an object
read <object>: Used to read an object
restore: Used to restore the player's health to its maximum level
savegame: Used to save the game state to a file
sit <on> <object>: Used to sit on certain objects to restore health
take <object>: Used to place an object in the player's inventory
unequip <object>: Used to deactivate wearable and wieldable objects
unlock <object|direction|exit description>: Used to unlock an object or a door

help.description: -->Used to attack a ghost
-->Used to drink objects that restore health
-->Used to remove objects from inventory
-->Used on eat objects that restore heatlh
-->Used to activate wearable and wieldable objects
-->Used to move a player a direction
-->Used to move a player through an exit
-->Used to move a player a direction
-->Used to move a player through an exit
-->Used to list status of all ghosts
-->Used to list supported verbs
-->Used to list objects in the player's inventory
-->Used to lay on objects that modify health
-->Used to light certain objects
-->Loads a saved game
-->Used to get the long description of an object
-->Used to look under an object
-->Used to look on top of an object
-->Used to look behind an object
-->Used to look inside an object
-->Used to look above an object
-->Used to pull an object
-->Used to push an object
-->Used to read an object
-->Used to save the game state to a file
-->Used to sit on certain objects to restore health
-->Used to place an object in the player's inventory
-->Used to deactivate wearable and wieldable objects
-->Used to unlock an exit in a given direction.
-->Used to unlock an exit.
-->Used to unlock an object.
